sense.def: the sound m; the consonant m

cit.quote: amussa o saṃ
\ ca to vā, \Kaccv 203,\lines{8}: assa ca to hoti vā
adato ca assa to vā
pa pha ba bha
vaggā pañcapañcaso ā
o pan’ ettha padasandhikaraṇatthaṃ vutto
o padasandhimattaṃ
o padasandhikaro
o nipātamattaṃ
o padasandhivasena vutto
o pana vyañjanasandhivasena vutto
dakāro ca padasandhikaro \dots\ o viya
vyañjanasandhivasena aṃ ādāya
assa rakāraṃ katvā
sare pare yakāro vakāro o dakāro \dots\ imā āgamā honti
gamu icc etassa dhātussa anto o ccho hoti vā
buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmī ti evaṃ ekasambaddhāni anunāsikantāni vā katvā dātabbāni, buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmī ti evaṃ vicchinditvā āni vā katvā dātabbāni
kakārādayo ā pañcapañcaso akkharavanto vaggā nāma honti
kakārādayo ā vaggā nāma bhavanti
i ya ta \ ki esa icc etesaṃ sabba\-nāmānaṃ
\ iti ādeseka\-desena amha\-saddaṃ
vattamānā ti anti si tha mi \ te ante se vhe e mhe
pañcamī tu antu hi tha mi \ taṃ antaṃ ssu vho e āmase
mi \ iti uttama\-purisā

sense.def: the suffix ma for forming ordinal numbers

cit.quote: saṅkhyā\-pūraṇe o; \Kaccv 135,\lines{14}: saṅkhyā\-pūraṇatthe -paccayo hoti
o vuccati cando \dots\ Ekakkhara\-kosato nayaṃ gahetvā o Sivo candimā cevā ti
ehi im āruyha
ete hi \dots\ maṃdīpā maṃleṇā ā maṃsaraṇā viharanti
puttapemaṃ bhante chaviṃ chindati, chaviṃ chetvā cammaṃ \dots\ aṃ chindati, aṃ chetvā nhāruṃ \dots\ aṭṭhiṃ \dots\ aṭṭhimiñjaṃ āhacca tiṭṭhati
attano pi āni pariccattāni \dots\ na ca bhikkhave appaṭivekkhitvā aṃ paribhuñjitabbaṃ
aññatarassa bhikkhuno bhuñjantassa aṃ kaṇṭhe vilaggaṃ hoti
yesaṃ aṃ kappati tesaṃ \dots
bhojaniyaṃ nāma pañca bhojanāni odano kummāso sattu maccho aṃ
paṇīta\-bhojanāni seyyath' īdaṃ sappi navanītaṃ telaṃ madhu phāṇitaṃ maccho aṃ khīraṃ dadhi
yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā aṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, paṭidesetabbaṃ
acelako \dots\ na macchaṃ na aṃ na sūram na merayaṃ na thusodakaṃ pivati
aṭṭhiṃ ca paṭicca nahāruṃ ca paṭicca aṃ ca paṭicca cammaṃ ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito rūpan t' eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati

taṃ samaṇo Gotamo jānaṃ uddissakaṭaṃ aṃ paribhuñjati paṭiccakamman ti [= \Vin I 237,\lines{26} \textit{\foll;} \A IV 187,\lines{19} \textit{\foll}] \dots\ tīhi kho ahaṃ Jīvaka ṭhānehi aṃ aparibhogan ti vadāmi: diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ parisaṅkitaṃ
balivaddo \dots\ āni tassa vaḍḍhanti
esu khīyamānesu bhiyyo cittaṃ pasīdati
nakhapattāni ato amuttaṭṭhāne lākhārasapūritāni viya
kesa\-loma\-danta\-nakhānaṃ -vinimutta\-ṭṭhānaṃ; \textit{\cf} \Vismmht I 449,\lines{22}: kesādīnam pi hi ato avimuttabhāgo
gāyitvā suraṃ pivanti aṃ khādanti
aṃ pacitvā khāditvā
asi tikkho va amhi pesuññaṃ parivattati
cammehi cammaṃ ehi aṃ nahārūhi nahāruṃ paṭipādetvā
sāduṃ ca thullaṃ ca muduṃ ca aṃ
aṃ aṅgāresu pacitvā
ena vinā bhattaṃ na bhuñjati
catuppadaṃ sakuṇaṃ cāpi aṃ
yathāpi maccho balisaṃ vaṃkaṃ ena chāditaṃ āmagiddho na jānāti
ā pūvā saṃkuliyo kummāsā macchasaṃyutā maggamhi patitiṭṭhantu
kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco aṃ nahāru \dots
assa rūhanatthāya ālepena ca ālimpīyati
aṃ nāma imasmiṃ sarīre pāṭiyekko kotthāso acetano avyākato suñño nissatto thaddho pathavī\-dhātū ti
aṃ visuṃ katvā maṃsa\-rasaṃ gaṇhathā ti
lūkha\-bhojane kucchi\-gate \dots\ aṃ milāyati
valittacatā ti iminā aṃ milāpetvā
devatā \dots\ āvudhāni mahājanassa upari phalake aṃ koṭṭayamānā viya pātayiṃsu
taca\-parigaṇhakena ca yogāvacarena \dots\ tacassa assa ca antarena cittaṃ pesentena
aṭṭhi\-saṅghāto \dots\ ena anupalitto
na hi -samaṃ kiñci aññaṃ dehassa vaḍḍhanaṃ

sense.def: flesh as one of the 31 or 32 constituents of the human body

cit.quote: atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco aṃ nahārū \dots\ muttan ti
\dots\ muttaṃ matthake matthaluṅgaṃ
vakka\-pañcake aṃ nahāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṃ vakkan ti

sense.xr:
\textit{\ifc see} akkhikamaṃsa akkhika\=/\ (\textit{\sv} akkhika\textsuperscript{2}), aṅgāramaṃsa aṅgāra\=/, kuramaṃsa kura\=/,
gaṇḍamaṃsa gaṇḍa\=/, cuṇṇikamaṃsa cuṇṇika\=/\ (\textit{\sv} cuṇṇiya\=/), pavattamaṃsa pavatta\=/\ (\textit{\sv} pavattati), piṭṭhimaṃsa piṭṭhi\=/, piṇḍikamaṃsa piṇḍika\=/\ (\textit{\sv} piṇḍikā)

cit.quote: dasa ā akappiyā
eka-e thullaccayaṃ nava-esu dukkaṭaṃ; \Sp 1381,\lines{32--33}: eka-e thullaccayan ti manussa-e. nava esu dukkaṭan ti sesa akappiya-esu
esu hi dasa manussa-hatthi-assa-suṇakha-ahi-sīha-byaggha-dīpi-accha-taracchānaṃ āni akappiyāni
yā tā santi sīhiniyo pi byagghiniyo pi \dots\ kin nu tā kakkhaḷāni aṭṭhikāni āni khādantīti

sense.def: beauty of flesh (according to \cts either red hands and feet, or red and fresh lips; one of the five beauties of a young woman)

cit.quote: chavi\-kalyāṇaṃ aṃ nahārukalyāṇaṃ aṭṭhikalyāṇaṃ vayakalyāṇan ti \dots\ cattāro pan' assā hattha\-pādā mukha\-pariyosānaṃ ca lākhā\-pari\-kamma\-katā viya ratta\-pavāḷa\-ratta\-kambala\-sadisā hoti. ayam assā atā
\dots\ aṃ \dots\ mahā\-puññāya hi itthiyā \dots\ dantā\-varaṇaṃ bimba\-phala\-sadisaṃ vaṇṇa\-sam\-pannaṃ samaṃ su\-phassitaṃ hoti, idaṃ aṃ nāma
udaraṃ nāma \dots\ anto \=/pali\-veṭhana\-kiliṭṭha\-pāvāraka\-pupphaka\-sadisaṃ, \textit{\Be, \Ce, \Ee so; \Se} \=/kiliṭṭhaṃpāvāra\-pupphaka\=/
\dots\ \=/pali\-veṭhitaṃ kiliṭṭha\-pāvāra\-puppha\-sadisaṃ

sense.def: totality of flesh, entirety o.\ f.

cit.quote: go\-ghātako \dots\ gāviṃ vadhitvā \dots\ anupa\-hacca antaraṃ aṃ \dots\ antarā cilīmaṃ \dots\ saṃ\-chindeyya
idh' ekacco \dots\ camma\-kāyaṃ yaṃ rudhira\-kāyaṃ \dots\ aniccato anu\-passati
\=/potthaniyā aggaṃ viya vinatā [\textit{\scil} kesā]

sense.def: a piece of meat, a.\ p.\ o.\ tissue

cit.quote: mugga\-bīja\-mattam pi aṃ mayhaṃ kucchi jīretuṃ na sakkhissati, \textit{\Be so; \Ee, \Se} kucchiṃ
sūṇato mahantaṃ aṃ kiṇitvā sūlena aṅgāresu pacāpetvā
dvattiṃsa--ppabhedaṃ papphāsa\-maṃsaṃ
aṃ mukhe ṭhapesi
o nāma natthī ti
khura\-pari\-yantena ce pi cakkena yo imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekaṃ aṃ ekaṃ maṃsa\-puñjaṃ kareyya, \textit{\Be, \Se so; \Ce, \Ee} eka-aṃ eka\-maṃsa\-puñjaṃ
pāṇā te \dots\ ekaṃ aṃ ekaṃ maṃsa\-puñjaṃ karissāmī ti, \textit{\Be, \Se so; \Ce, \Ee} eka-aṃ eka\-maṃsa\-puñjaṃ
tena pana gahita-o eko kūṭa\-jaṭilo atthi
na tvaṃ vāraṇaṃ vadhitvā \=/yoniyaṃ nibbatto, \textit{\Be so; \Ee, \Se} maṃsaṃ khādaka\=/
nāyaṃ o ti bhatta\-kārako mayi āsaṃkaṃ na karissati
nibbatto rakkhaso para\-rudhira-o

sense.def: the fleshly eye, the natural faculty of sight

cit.quote: na kho rājañña evaṃ paraloko daṭṭhabbo yathā tvaṃ maññasi iminā unā
ussa uppādo maggo dibbassa cakkhuno
yaṃ pana sutte vuttaṃ: usmiṃ naṭṭhe ahetusmiṃ avatthumhi n' atthi dibba\-cakkhussa uppādo ti
bhagavā pākatikena unā atta\-bhāva\-pariyā\-pannena purima\-sucarita\-kammā\-bhini\-bbattena samantā yojanaṃ passati divā c' eva rattiṃ ca
sabba\-sattānaṃ cakkhu\-visayā\-tītāni tiro\-kuṭṭā\-di\-gatāni cāpi rūpāni ativi\-suddhena unā ca passatā [\textit{\scil} bhagavatā]
tiro\-kuṭṭā\-di\-gataṃ rūpaṃ āvaraṇa\-virahitaṃ pakati-unā dakkhati
u cakkhu\-pasādo
unā hi dibba\-cakkhunā vā ariyā diṭṭhā pi adiṭṭhā va honti, tesaṃ cakkhūnaṃ vaṇṇa\-matta\-ggahaṇato, na ariya\-bhāva\-gocarato
u pi duvidhaṃ sasambhāra\-cakkhu pasāda\-cakkhū ti
unā vā ti pakati\-cakkhunā
u dibba\-cakkhu paññā\-cakkhu
so tiṇṇaṃ cakkhūnaṃ tamo uno dibba\-cakkhuno paññā\-cakkhuno
bhagavā pañcahi cakkhūhi vivaṭa\-cakkhu, unā pi vivaṭa\-cakkhu, dibba\-cakkhunā pi \dots\ paññā\-cakkhunā pi \dots\ buddha\-cakkhunā pi \dots\ samanta\-cakkhunā pi \dots
u dibba\-cakkhu paññā\-cakkhu buddha\-cakkhu samanta\-cakkhū ti imehi pañcahi cakkhūhi cakkhu\-matā [\textit{\scil} buddhena]
duvidhaṃ cakkhu: u ca paññā\-cakkhu ca
unā c' eva paññā\-cakkhunā cā ti dvīhi cakkhūhi cakkhumā [\textit{\scil} puriso]
dve cakkhūni: ñāṇa\-cakkhuṃ c' eva uṃ ca
asisūnan ti maṃsa\-cchedakaṃ asiṃ c' eva adhi\-kuṭṭanaṃ ca, \textit{\Be, \Se so; \Ee} maṃsa\-cchedana-asiṃ
potthanikan ti maṃsa\-cchedana\-satthakaṃ vuccati

sense.def: water in which meat has been washed (of a blackish colour)

cit.quote: taṃ pan' etaṃ [\textit{\scil} lohitaṃ] \dots\ moha\-caritassa maṃsa\-dhovana-udaka\-sadisaṃ
maccha\-dhovana\-maṃsa\-dhovana\-taṇḍula\-dhovana-\dots-vaccādīhi sammissāni \dots\ oḷigallāni ceva candanika\-ṭṭhānāni ca daṭṭhabbāni honti
kalalā sattāha\-ccayena maṃsa\-dhovana-udaka\-vaṇṇaṃ abbudaṃ nāma hoti
atīsāro yakim\-piṇda\-maṃsa\-dhāvana\-nīlihi \dots\ samo, \textit{\vl} \=/maṃsa\-dhovana\=/

sense.def: (a jackal or dog) that has buried meat; (as a simile for a forgetful or dull-witted person)

cit.quote: muṭṭha\-ssatino bhatta\-nikkhitta\-kāka--sigāla\-sadisā, \textit{\Be, \Se so; \Ee} \=/maṃsa\-nissita\=/
muṭṭha\-ssatīti bhatta\-nikkhitta\-kāko viya \=/sunakho viya ca naṭṭha\-ssati, idha kataṃ ettha na sarati, \textit{\Be, \Se so; \Ee} muṭṭha\=/ \textit{\io} naṭṭha\=/
bhatta\-nikkhitta\-kāka--sunakha\-sadisānaṃ momūha\-puggalānaṃ dūrato pariccajanā

sense.def: [plastered] with flesh and sewn together with sinews; ? (\cf \eg \Th 569--570; K.\,R.\ Norman, 2007: sewn together with flesh and sinew)

cit.quote: aṭṭhi\-kaṅkala\-kuṭike e dhir atthu, \Tha III 167,\lines{12--13}: nahāru\-pasibbite ti navahi nahāru\-satehi samantato sibbite [\textit{no mention of} maṃsa\=/]

sense.def: (\anat) a flap of flesh, a.\ f.\ o.\ tissue

cit.quote: yakanan ti yamaka-aṃ
mahā\-purisassa pana kaṭito paṭṭhāya aṃ yāva khandhā uggamma \dots\ piṭṭhiṃ chādetvā patiṭṭhitaṃ
tathāgatassa pana \dots\ aṃ \dots
ena ca yogāva\-carena

sense.def: (\anat) a lump of flesh, a.\ l.\ o.\ tissue; (more rarely) a lump of meat

cit.quote: addasaṃ °\=/piṇḍaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ, \Sp 509,\lines{8}: maṃsa\-piṇḍa\-peto
sigālo hutvā mukhena °\=/piṇḍaṃ gahetvā
mayā vissaṭṭha-°\=/piṇḍena viya senena pañca\-kāma\-guṇe pahāya
vakkan ti ekabandhanā dve °\=/piṇḍikā
vakkaṃ \dots\ dve °\=/piṇḍikā
akkhi\-kūpake nahāru\-suttakena ābaddhaṃ aṃ cakkhū ti
akkhi\-kūpake akkhi\-paṭalehi pari\-vārito °\=/piṇḍo
eko seno °\=/piṇḍo ayan ti saññāya dārakaṃ vijjhituṃ āgacchati, \textit{\Be, \Se so; \Ee} °\=/piṇḍako
yathā haliddi\-pilotika\-paṭi\-cchanne e na o jānāti maṃ nissāya haliddi\-pilotikā ṭhitā ti, \textit{\Be, \Se so; \Ee} \=/paṭi\-cchanne na ā

sense.def: a piece of meat, a.\ p.\ o.\ flesh

cit.quote: kulalena ukkhittaṃ iṃ sāmikānaṃ dassāmī ti
addasaṃ iṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantiṃ, \textit{\cf \sv} maṃsapiṇḍa °\=/piṇḍa
kāmaṃ bhijjatu 'yaṃ kāyo ī visīyaruṃ
sigālā ratti\-bhāgena phullaṃ disvāna kiṃsukaṃ ī ti maññantā
vaṭṭa\-potako ajāta\-pakkho taruṇo \ kulāvake
sarīraṃ nāma atireka\-tisata-aṭṭhika\-samussayaṃ \dots\ nava--satānu\-littaṃ
aṭṭhi\-saṅghāṭo \dots\ nava--sata\-ppa\-bhedena maṃsena litto
lobho \dots\ abhi\-saṅga\-raso tatta\-kapāle khittaṃ \ viya
seno viya iṃ gahetvā
sā \dots\ alattaka\-paṭala\-bandhu\-jīvaka\-puppha\-sadisaṃ iṃ vijāyi
ī ti \dots\ nandi\-rāgass' etaṃ adhi\-vacanaṃ
seyyathā \dots\ divasa\-santatte ayo\-kaṭāhe ī pakkhittā khippaṃ yeva paṭi\-vi\-gacchati na cira\-ṭṭhitikā hoti, evam eva \dots\ '\=/ūpamaṃ manussānaṃ jīvitaṃ

sense.def: eating meat, feeding on meat; a meat eater (said mainly of carnivores, yakkhas, and the like)

cit.quote: para\-ruhira-o yakkho
o tuvaṃ rāja [\textit{\scil} Garuḷa] phala\-bhakkho ayaṃ dijo
paṇḍu\-sīho paṇḍu\-palāsa\-vaṇṇa\-gāvī\-sadiso o
e kuto dayā

sense.def: a portion of meat, a share o.\ m.

cit.quote: maccha\-bhāgo o \dots\ catusaṭṭhi\-kahāpaṇo vā daṇḍo ti
esāma\-gandho na hi aṃ
a\=/aṃ upa\-nāmetuṃ na sakkomi
sīho yathā lohita\=/o \dots\ tath' itthiyo
yakkho \dots\ apari\-mita\=/o ahosi
āmaka-ānaṃ paṭi\-ggahaṇam
paṭi\-cchāda\-nīyenā ti ena
tam enaṃ \dots\ gharaṃ netvā ena parivisi
gaṇḍūsa\-dhāraṇe niccaṃ telaṃ o 'tha vā

sense.def: the consumption of meat broth (Horner, 1978, \p xxxix: meal consisting of a flesh product)

cit.quote: pari\-nibbāna\-divase \=/bhojanaṃ \dots\ imā samatiṃsa sabba\-buddhānaṃ dhammatā ti

aṭṭhi\-kaṅkalaṃ suni\-kantaṃ nikantaṃ aṃ lohita\-makkhitaṃ, \textit{\Ee \vl a\=/\ in the first place; quoted} \NiddaI 31,\lines{14} \textit{\foll}: \textit{\Be so in all places; \Ee} a\=/\ \textit{in all places;} \Ps III 43,\lines{4--5}: ten' ev' āha an ti. lohitaṃ pana makkhetvā tiṭṭhati tena vuttaṃ lohita\-makkhitan ti; \textit{\cf below} nimmaṃsa\-lohita\-makkhita \=/lohita\-makkhita
aṭṭhi\-kaṅkalan ti \dots\ attā kaṅkalan ti vuccati
aṭṭhi\-kaṅkalūpamā ti \dots\ atāya kaṅkalan ti ca vuccati
buddhānaṃ hi eṇimigass' eva anu\-pubbavaṭṭā jaṃghā honti na purato ā pacchato suṃsumāra\-kucchi viya uddhumātā

aṭṭhika\-saṃ\-khalikaṃ lohita\-makkhitaṃ nahāru\-sam\-bandhaṃ, \textit{\Se so; \Be} nimaṃsa\=/; \textit{\Ce, \Ee against \mss} nimmaṃsaṃ; \Sv 772,\lines{11--12}: lohita\-makkhitan ti maṃse khīṇe pi lohitaṃ na sussati, \textit{\Ce, \Ee, \Se so; \Be} nimaṃsa\=/
tassa [\textit{\scil} kammassa] kira narakā cavanakāle nimmaṃsa\-katānaṃ gunnaṃ aṭṭhirāsi yeva nimittaṃ ahosi
